channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street lighting not working, 20th June
item.description:
Round the back of Coupland Place in the alleyway, the street lighting is out and has been for the past few weeks. We have elderly neighbours whose only option to get out is by using the ramp and steps. This does include the evening too. Without working lighting, the are finding it extremely difficult to navigate the steps. This is an accident waiting to happen and can be easily rectified by being fixed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coupland Place, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights vandalised EXTREME danger, 20th June
item.description:
The traffic lights at the top of wellington street, junction with John Wilson street have been vandalised. The green light has been repositioned to face the pedestrians on the crossing rather than the oncoming traffic at the cross-roads, and it is still working. I am very concerned that an unaccompanied child will missintepret the very visible green light as a signal that they can cross, when the oncoming traffic from Charlton is still being directed to come that way. The red and green man on that side of the crossing are very dim, so the bright green "go" light takes precidence. Even though I am an adult I had to stop.and think for a minute as to whether or not it was safe to cross. A child may very well not do this. Please fix the lights ASAP before someone gets seriously hurt. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Used condoms and packaging spread across pavement, 20th June
item.description:
Used condoms and over 10 sleeves/packaging on the pavement and edge of the street, just outside our houses. I would also report the antisocial behaviour clearly behind it, and given the recent violent incidents, but not sure what is the best way to get decent attention to this escalation of serious issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
